sources.title: ThoughtWorks – Architecture as Code: The Next Evolution
sources.summary: Defines Architecture as Code as executable specifications and critiques traditional architecture practices such as slideware-heavy governance.

sources.title: Red Hat – Architecture as Code Principles and Best Practices
sources.summary: Explains the core principles of codified architecture and prescribes governance for single sources of truth.

sources.title: AaC Open Source Project – Architecture-as-Code Repository
sources.summary: Demonstrates the AaC plugin ecosystem and self-describing model definitions used throughout Architecture as Code tooling.

sources.title: Thoughtworks Technology Radar – Governance as Code
sources.summary: Describes opinionated governance patterns required when architecture intent is enforced as code.

sources.title: Brown, Simon – C4 Model Overview
sources.summary: Defines the Context, Container, Component, and Code levels for consistent architectural diagramming.

sources.title: Brown, Simon – Documenting Software Architecture with Structurizr
sources.summary: Introduces automation techniques to prevent diagram decay and align audiences with appropriate C4 model views.

sources.title: CNCF – State of Cloud Native Development, 2024
sources.summary: Reports adoption data for microservices, containers, and platform engineering used to motivate Architecture as Code.

sources.title: Selic, Bran – The Pragmatics of Model-Driven Development
sources.summary: Provides historical context and critiques of model-driven development practices that inform modern AaC narratives.

sources.title: GitLab – Building a Single Source of Truth with APIs and CLI
sources.summary: Details CLI and API mechanisms that underpin SSOT delivery mechanisms for Architecture as Code platforms.

sources.title: MarketsandMarkets – Infrastructure as Code Market Report
sources.summary: Quantifies the Infrastructure as Code market size and projected growth used to justify investment narratives.

sources.title: Gartner – Forecast Analysis: Public Cloud Services Worldwide
sources.summary: Provides economic rationale for cloud-native governance and Architecture as Code adoption.

sources.title: IDC – Worldwide DevOps Software Tools Forecast, 2023–2027
sources.summary: Frames the economic benefits and tooling investments tied to Infrastructure and Architecture as Code.

sources.title: HashiCorp – State of Cloud Strategy Survey 2024
sources.summary: Highlights organisational drivers for codified governance and platform engineering investments.

sources.title: AWS – Cloud Development Kit (CDK) Developer Guide
sources.summary: Demonstrates higher-level abstractions that bridge Infrastructure as Code and Architecture as Code.

sources.title: Pulumi – Testing Infrastructure as Code Programs
sources.summary: Describes unit and integration testing patterns that distinguish Pulumi from declarative-only tools.

sources.title: HashiCorp – Securing Terraform State
sources.summary: Provides guidance for encrypting, storing, and controlling access to Infrastructure as Code state files.
